children.value: Web Applications Developer specializing in TypeScript, Vue/Nuxt, and AI-driven development. Experienced in building novel UI patterns and simulation-based learning tools for the web.
A list of projects I've worked on
Some writings on topics that are close to my heart

My name is Victor Zellweger, and I am a Software Engineer passionate about creating interactive multimedia applications. With expertise in JavaScript, TypeScript, React, Vue.js, and AWS services, I build engaging web applications featuring interactive visualizations and simulations. At the moment, I am particularly interested in front-end frameworks, web-based graphics, and media design.

My background in higher education has refined my ability to design, implement, and deliver innovative solutions across diverse domains, including mathematics, physics, engineering, and chemistry, to support and enhance educational initiatives.

Beyond my technical work, I am deeply passionate about digital art and music production. In my free time, I experiment with sound design in Ableton, drawing inspiration from artists like Aphex Twin and Autechre. Additionally, I am an amateur naturalist, fascinated by observing the botanical, mycological, and geological features of different areas.
Explore my projects to see how I combine creativity and technical expertise to build impactful digital experiences. Let's connect and create something exciting together!

children.value: Some of the software and technologies I use regularly
Let's talk about your ideas, projects or anything else

contents.title: FAQ
contents.subtitle: Things I get asked a lot

questions.title: What services do you offer?
questions.answer: I offer a range of services including web design, web development, branding, and photography. I can also help with SEO and social media marketing.

questions.title: Can you teach me how to make a website?
questions.answer: I don't offer courses at the moment, but I can recommend resources and advice to help you get the most out of your learning.

questions.title: How much does a project cost?
questions.answer: The cost of a project depends on many factors, such as the size of the project, the features, the development time, etc. The initial amount of my web services starts at 2000€, with an average between 3000€ and 10000€. For any other design or consulting service, I usually charge 450€ per day.

questions.title: How does payment work for a project?
questions.answer: I ask for a 40% deposit before starting a project, and the remaining 60% after successful delivery. I accept payments by bank transfer, PayPal, etc...

questions.title: How long does a project take?
questions.answer: It's difficult to give an exact estimate, as each project is different, but the majority of my past work has taken between 2 weeks and 2 months.

questions.title: Do you offer discounts?
questions.answer: I offer a 15% discount for students and non-profit organizations.

questions.title: What do you enjoy most about this work?
questions.answer: I love learning new things and being able to create just about anything from scratch, creating beautiful things that people will use and appreciate.

questions.title: Hobbies outside of work?
questions.answer: I love what I do, so I usually spend a lot of time working on personal projects, photography, etc. I'm also a big sports fan. I often go to the gym and I recently started climbing!

contents.title: Bird Identification
contents.description: Designed to aid students in identifying birds in the wild, this game features two immersive virtual environments - a forest and a wetland. Each environment is populated by 10 different bird species. Students explore these environments, listen to bird calls, and use a mini map to locate and photograph each species.
contents.name: Bird Identification Game

contents.title: Blood Pressure
contents.description: A virtual training for teaching students how to measure a patient's blood pressure using a stethoscope and blood pressure cuff. Audio cues, controlled by Tone.js, simulate the sound typically heard through the stethoscope.
contents.name: Blood Pressure Measurement

contents.title: Labshell
contents.description: Labshell is an online interactive platform used to simulate in-person labs, allowing students who are part of Oregon State Ecampus to perform the labs required for their degree from a remote setting. This platform hosts over 1000 active users and currently offers 30 different Chemistry labs.
contents.name: LabShell

contents.title: SLIDE
contents.description: SLIDE is an online interactive platform designed to add interactivity to PowerPoint style presentations. While maintaining this project I improved bug reporting, media playback, and accessibility within the platform (in addition to many bug fixes). This platform hosts over 150 current lectures and sees thousands of active users every term. Some of the technologies used to construct the SLIDE platform include React, Redux, Typescript, AWS Lambda, AWS S3, AWS Codepipeline, and Nodejs.
contents.name: SLIDE

contents.title: Traverse Simulator
contents.description: This 3d construction surveying interactive simulates the process of creating a traverse network on OSU's McNary field. The goal of this project is to provide a virtual alternative to an in-person activity performed at the on-campus field.
contents.name: Construction Surveying Simulator
